channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Everybody Knows
item.description: The relationship between group rape, athletics, and social status, in light of Kavanaugh and Glen Ridge.

item.title: Conversations with Bongjun
item.description: Bongjun, from South Korea, argues South and North share a tendency towards political absurdity.

item.title: Gluten Free Antarctica
item.description: Conflicts and bonding over food en route to Antarctica.

item.title: A Business With No End
item.description: A network of Amazon-fronted dropshippers run by a christian university.

item.title: There's No Such Thing as a Free Watch
The 30-Year Secret, etc.
item.description: WW's investigation into Goldschmidt's repeated rape of a teenager deserves a re-read after The Power Broker.

item.title: Elizabeth Lynn Dunham: May 12, 1961–Jan. 16, 2011
item.description: Obit for E. Dunham, "Susan" from the WW Goldschmidt stories.

item.title: If San Francisco is so great, why is everyone I love leaving?
item.description: The Californians in Portland are an exodus from San Francisco.

item.title: A Suspense Novelist's Trail of Deceptions
item.description: It's like Anna Delvey, but literary-pretentious.

item.title: The Digital Humanities Debacle
item.description: If digital humanities hold promise, it is at the threshold of computer science; for now, lots of junk.

item.title: What You Need to Know about Gustav Klimt
item.description: Super brief, but I appreciated the overview.
